content: The synthesis used in this work was adapted from the literature, and a different cerium mellitate structure is reported elsewhere. CeCl3·7H2O (68.0 mg, 0.183 mmol) was dissolved in DI H2O (0.750 mL) in a 7 mL scintillation vial. Excess H6mell (72.1 mg, 0.211 mmol) was dissolved in DI H2O (0.750 mL), and the mixture was added to the Ce solution. On the 1.5 mL aqueous solution was carefully layered EtOH (4 mL). While the solution was left to stand overnight, large colorless crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction measurements formed (71.0 mg, 97.4% yield). Crystals were washed with ethanol (3 × 2 mL) prior to being isolated and placed under oil.
clean_text:
Ce2(mell)(H2O)8⋅2H2O (Ce-1β)

The synthesis used in this work was adapted from the literature, and a different cerium mellitate structure is reported elsewhere. CeCl3⋅7H2O (68.0 mg, 0.183 mmol) was dissolved in DI H2O (0.750 mL) in a 7 mL scintillation vial. Excess H6mell (72.1 mg, 0.211 mmol) was dissolved in DI H2O (0.750 mL), and the mixture was added to the Ce solution. On the 1.5 mL aqueous solution was carefully layered EtOH (4 mL). While the solution was left to stand overnight, large colorless crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction measurements formed (71.0 mg, 97.4% yield). Crystals were washed with ethanol (3 × 2 mL) prior to being isolated and placed under oil.
